item.title: Lisa add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Lisa add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Malcolm Forbes
item.description: "The true measure of a man is how he treats someone who can do him absolutely no good." -- Malcolm Forbes

item.title: Lisa add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "This above all: to thine own self be true, And it must follow, as the night the day, Thou canst not then be false to any man." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Lisa add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "Do one thing every day that scares you." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I am enough of an artist to draw freely upon my imagination. Imagination is more important than knowledge. Knowledge is limited. Imagination encircles the world." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Science without religion is lame, religion without science is blind." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "I can only note that the past is beautiful because one never realises an emotion at the time. It expands later, and thus we don't have complete emotions about the present, only about the past." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Nothing ever fatigues me, but doing what I do not like." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Tony Blair
item.description: "A simple way to take measure of a country is to look at how many want in.. And how many want out." -- Tony Blair

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Freya Stark
item.description: "To awaken quite alone in a strange town is one of the most pleasant sensations in the world. You are surrounded by adventure." -- Freya Stark

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Freya Stark
item.description: "Love of learning is a pleasant and universal bond since it deals with what one is and not what one has." -- Freya Stark

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "If you have built castles in the air, your work need not be lost; that is where they should be. Now put the foundations under them." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "There is no remedy for love, but to love more." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "It's not what you look at that matters, it's what you see." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "What lies behind us and what lies ahead of us are tiny matters compared to what lives within us." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "If a man does not keep pace with his companions, perhaps it is because he hears a different drummer. Let him step to the music he hears, however measured or far away." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "I learned this, at least, by my experiment: that if one advances confidently in the direction of his dreams, and endeavors to live the life which he has imagined, he will meet with a success unexpected in common hours." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "How vain it is to sit down to write when you have not stood up to live." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Lisa add a quote by William Arthur Ward
item.description: "Flatter me, and I may not believe you. Criticize me, and I may not like you. Ignore me, and I may not forgive you. Encourage me, and I will not forget you. Love me and I may be forced to love you." -- William Arthur Ward

item.title: Lisa add a quote by William Arthur Ward
item.description: "The pessimist complains about the wind; the optimist expects it to change; the realist adjusts the sails." -- William Arthur Ward

item.title: Lisa add a quote by William Arthur Ward
item.description: "The adventure of life is to learn. The purpose of life is to grow. The nature of life is to change. The challenge of life is to overcome. The essence of life is to care. The opportunity of like is to serve. The secret of life is to dare. The spice of life is to befriend. The beauty of life is to give." -- William Arthur Ward

item.title: Lisa add a quote by William Arthur Ward
item.description: "The mediocre teacher tells. The good teacher explains. The superior teacher demonstrates. The great teacher inspires." -- William Arthur Ward

item.title: Lisa add a quote by William Arthur Ward
item.description: "We can choose to throw stones, to stumble on them, to climb over them, or to build with them." -- William Arthur Ward

item.title: Lisa add a quote by William Arthur Ward
item.description: "God gave you a gift of 86 400 seconds today. Have you used one to say thank you " -- William Arthur Ward

item.title: Lisa add a quote by William Arthur Ward
item.description: "When we seek to discover the best in others, we somehow bring out the best in ourselves." -- William Arthur Ward

item.title: Lisa add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "You are the music while the music lasts." -- T.S. Eliot
